intro: Hibbertia acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-horned sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in spring. It is part of the Dilleniaceae family and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Hibbertia acuminata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
